alert.note: Alert for Johnson; Washakie (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 23 at 1:42PM MDT until May 26 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Wyoming, including the following counties, Johnson and Washakie. * WHEN...Until 445 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Some low-water crossings may become impassable. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 142 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1.25 and 1.75 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... South Fork Little Canyon Creek, Red Fork Powder River, Middle Fork Powder River, Blue Creek, North Fork Beaver Creek and Beaver Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
